alert.note: Alert for Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 8:16PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Morrill County through 800 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of The Intersection Of Highway 385 And 92, or 28 miles south of Alliance, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broadwater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
